verses.roman:
vraja-rasa-gīta śuni' prema uthalila
puruṣottama-grāma prabhu preme bhāsāila

synonyms: vraja-rasa-gīta—songs about the mellows of Vṛndāvana-dhāma; śuni'-hearing; prema—transcendental bliss; uthalila—awakened; puruṣottama-grāma—the place known as Puruṣottama, Jagannātha Purī; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; preme—with ecstatic love; bhāsāila—inundated.
translation: Thus Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's ecstatic love was awakened by hearing the songs of Vṛndāvana. In this way He inundated Puruṣottama, Jagannātha Purī, with love of Godhead.
